name: Cranberry Pumpkin Muffins
author: Robin L.
summary: These yummy pumpkin muffins are perfect for the Thanksgiving table! Substitute toasted pumpkin seeds or dried cherries for the cranberries, if you wish.
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Grease or place paper muffin cups in a 12 cup muffin tin
Mix the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and nutmeg together in a mixing bowl
Beat the canned pumpkin, eggs, butter, buttermilk, and vanilla together in another large mixing bowl
Gradually beat in the flour mixture until well blended
Stir in the dried cranberries until evenly blended
Spoon batter into muffin tins about 3/4 full
Bake in preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the middle of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes
3 minutes before turning out from pan
Serve warm or at room temperature
